appendChildrenFromEnvironmental

public org.w3c.dom.Element appendChildrenFromEnvironmental(java.lang.String appName,
                                                           org.w3c.dom.Document doc,
                                                           java.lang.String rootName,
                                                           boolean appendTo)
                                                    throws intradoc.common.ServiceException
Build DOM document from binder local properties

Parameters:
appName - - application name for key lookup
doc - - DOM document to create elements and text node
rootName - - Name for Environmental key lookup and the name of the tag of returned element Note: Environmental variables will be expected to be presented in the following format: {appName}.{rootName}.{Field Name} Where: "Application Name" will be stored within the application code "XML Node Name" will be determined by the expected XML output "Field Name" will be determined by the expected XML output
appendTo - - flag to determine root element acquistion method
Returns:
A new Element object with the nodeName attribute set to rootName with children associated to the found lookup keys
Throws:
java.io.IOException - - if any errors occur parsing the found value.
intradoc.common.ServiceException

appendChildrenFromLocal

public org.w3c.dom.Element appendChildrenFromLocal(java.lang.String appName,
                                                   org.w3c.dom.Document doc,
                                                   java.lang.String rootName)
                                            throws intradoc.common.ServiceException
Build DOM document from binder local properties

Parameters:
appName - - application name for key lookup
doc - - DOM document to create elements and text node
rootName - - Name for Environmental key lookup and the name of the tag of returned element Note: Local variable "fields" will be expected to return the field names available to retrieve Note: Local variables will be expected to be presented in the following format: {appName}.{rootName}.{Field Name} Where: "Application Name" will be stored within the application code "XML Node Name" will be determined by the expected XML output "Field Name" will be determined by the expected XML output
Returns:
A new Element object with the nodeName attribute set to rootName with children associated to the found lookup keys
Throws:
intradoc.common.ServiceException - - error if {appName}.{rootName}.fields not defined in binder or the value is blank

parseChildrenToLocal

                                 org.w3c.dom.Element root,
                                 java.lang.String baseName,
                                 int index)
Parse DOM document at root element down through the named base element

Parameters:
appName - - application name for key lookup and insertion
root - - DOM parent node with named node to
baseName - - name of key lookup, Element under root, and binder return value(s)
index - - index of node under root to extract

sortField - - name of existing XML node

appendTextNodeToChild

public org.w3c.dom.Element appendTextNodeToChild(org.w3c.dom.Document doc,
                                                 org.w3c.dom.Element root,
                                                 java.lang.String name,
                                                 java.lang.String value)
                                          throws intradoc.common.ServiceException
Injects values, as text node, into named node under root element

Parameters:
doc - - DOM document to create text node to be appended
root - - DOM node used to retrieve named node and return results
name - - Name of node to append text node within
value - - Text to append
Returns:
The passed in Root Node with children, one child will have been updated with a new text
Throws:
intradoc.common.ServiceException - - if named element not found

sortChildNodes

protected void sortChildNodes(org.w3c.dom.Node node,
                              boolean descending,
                              int depth,
                              java.util.Comparator comparator)
Sorts the children of the given node upto the specified depth if available

Parameters:
node - - node whose children will be sorted
descending - - true for sorting in descending order
depth - - depth upto which to sort in DOM
comparator - - comparator used to sort, if null a default NodeName comparator is used.
